qas.question: What sales model did Dell use for a long time?
Who were the main driving force behind PC sales?
Where were consumers going to buy devices other than online?
What market presence did Dell lack?
What was one city that Dell tested retail stores in?
What sales model did Dell not use for a long time?
Who were the minor driving force behind PC sales?
Where were consumers going to buy devices other than offline?
What market presence did Dell have?
What was one city that Dell tested retail stores in?

context: Dell had long stuck by its <a0_0><b5_0>direct<b5_0/><a0_0/> sales model. <a1_0><b6_0>Consumers<b6_0/><a1_0/> had become the main drivers of PC sales in recent years, yet there had a decline in consumers purchasing PCs through the Web or on the phone, as increasing numbers were visiting <a2_0><b7_0>consumer electronics retail stores<b7_0/><a2_0/> to try out the devices first. Dell's rivals in the PC industry, HP, Gateway and Acer, had a long <b8_0>retail<b8_0/> presence and so were well poised to take advantage of the consumer shift. The lack of a <a3_0>retail<a3_0/> presence stymied Dell's attempts to offer consumer electronics such as flat-panel TVs and MP3 players. Dell responded by experimenting with mall kiosks, plus quasi-retail stores in <a4_0><b9_0>Texas<b9_0/><a4_0/> and New York.
